arm_group.description: subjects who do not smoke since 7 years

brief_summary.textblock:
Cigarette smoking is the most important modifiable cardiovascular risk factor leading to
      endothelial dysfunction and was suggested to impair arterial regeneration.The aim of the
      study was to investigate the effect of smoking on vascular response to transradial coronary
      angiography (TCA).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  all subjects underwent a TCA

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  acute inflammation cardiac arrhythmia renal failure heart failure (NYHA II-IV) CRP >
             1 mg/dl malignant disease

study_pop.textblock: all subjects who underwent an TCA (trans radial catheterisation)

facility.name: Division of Cardiology, Pulmonology and Vascular Medicine Duesseldorf,

clinical_study.official_title: Response-to-injury in Patients Undergoing Transradial Coronary Angiography: Arterial Remodeling in Smokers

other_outcome.description: measured by boyden chamber from blood plasma

overall_official.affiliation: Division of Cardiology, Pulmonology and Vascular Medicine
Division of Cardiology, Pulmonology and Vascular Medicine

primary_outcome.description: IMT is measured by high resolution ultrasound in the radial arteries.
primary_outcome.time_frame: change in radials IMT after 6-14 month after a TCA

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Klinik für Kardiologie, Pneumologie und Angiologie
responsible_party.investigator_title: Division of Cardiology, Pulmonary Diseases, Vascular Medicine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change in flow mediated dilatation after 10-14 months

lead_sponsor.agency: Klinik für Kardiologie, Pneumologie und Angiologie

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
